item.title: Automating Hugo Site Deployment with GitHub Actions and Private Repositories
item.description: I’ve always been a proponent of DevOps, and my recent experiments with Hugo have led me to automate the deployment of my site. This post details how I set up an automatic deployment process for my Hugo site using GitHub Actions while keeping my drafts and content private until I’m ready to share them. Keeping a Private Repository for Hugo Site Definition I have a private repository for my Hugo site definition to keep my draft posts and other content secure until they’re ready for the public.

item.title: Getting Running With Hugo
item.description: Choosing the Right Environment for Hugo Development: My Journey to Containers When it comes to setting up a development environment for Hugo, there are numerous options available. My journey in selecting the most suitable one was guided by a desire for efficiency and minimal impact on my primary workstation. Here, I share my experience and rationale behind choosing containers over other methods. Why Not Traditional Installations? Installing development tools directly on my laptop is a route I tend to avoid.

Set within Parts Unlimited a large manufacturing and retail organisation that is struggling to come to terms with software as a first class citizen. Yes for those of you who have read The Phoenix Project this story is set in the same organisation and you see many of the same characters and events that occurred. In fact this tale follows another character within the narrative that was only briefly introduced before, namely a developer.
